column4: I moved someone to Ubuntu, but she needs to make some changes to her website, which is written in ASP
Is ther a GUI toolkit that supports that (ASP)
you mean an IDE?
yeah.  Something like frontpage
i dont know about asp but try nvu or quanta+
it's just to allow yer to changes some text in it
nvu does not recognise the ASP
quanta is good, but no GUI part I thought (it's been a while)
well, it is a gui
or you want a wysiwyg editor
yeah
I dont know of any sorry
i use emacs :) and so should everyone else :P
LOL, I think she would freak at Emacs.  I'm kinda proud that the switch went so well
have you tried nvu?
yeah.  it would work, but it thinks that the asp is xml
yeah it doesnt like the %
indeed.  I'm worried that most editors will have that problem.
looks like your out of luck if you isist on wysiwyg editor
best to stick to somthing like bluefish or quanta imo wysiwygs suck'
I agree
but the user has only basic computer skills
its not computer skills you need.. its web development skills and imo, being able to use a wysiwyg editor does not mean you know how to develop webpages
